verbs.description: puritanize (third-person singular simple present puritanizes, present participle puritanizing, simple past and past participle puritanized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To agree with, or teach, the doctrines of Puritans; to conform to the practice of Puritans.
examples: M. PERKINS , in his Probleme though hee ſaine would puritanize it , and ſo goeth on, hanging hoofe againſt hoofe, yet confeſſeth, that the Fathers uſed to arm themſelves againſt the Divell with the ſigne of the Croſſe
